intro: Fimbristylis gracilenta var. psilopoda, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowering spikes. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes, swamps, and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
